A new report says 2020 was a record year for discovering new asteroids, particularly those with near-Earth orbits in spite of the COVID-19 pandemic shutting down a number of observatories.

articles.description:
A new report says 2020 was a record year for discovering new asteroids, particularly those with near-Earth orbits in spite of the COVID-19 pandemic shutting down a number of observatories.

The report, published Thursday in the science journal Nature, says as…
articles.title: Report: 2020 Record Year for Discovering Asteroids - Voice of America

articles.content:
More than 29 million cases have been reported in the U.S. since the World Health Organization declared the novel coronavirus a pandemic one year ago.
The virus plunged America into grief and crisis.… [+7772 chars]
articles.description: The U.S. has lost more than 530,000 people to the virus, Johns Hopkins University data shows. It's more than the number of Americans killed in World War I and World War II combined.
articles.title: A year after pandemic declared, COVID-19 numbers are way too high to relax just yet, CDC director warns - WMUR Manchester

articles.author: Anne Gearan, Miriam Berger
articles.content:
The United States authoritarian adversaries who worry far less about domestic opinion have the field mostly free for the moment to send vaccines to nations from Mexico to Lebanon to Uzbekistan.
That… [+9329 chars]
articles.description: Russia and China are winning goodwill by shipping vaccines to needy nations. The Biden administration has been unable to match that because of domestic political pressures and health needs.
articles.title: Biden faces pressure to distribute vaccines worldwide, while Americans still need them at home - The Washington Post
